description:
go.crypto/bn256: ensure that t is initialised correctly.

t caches the value of z squared, but wasn't getting correctly
initialised when the value of z was reset.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go.crypto

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=b2b2ae1f5140&repo=crypto ***

go.crypto/bn256: ensure that t is initialised correctly.

t caches the value of z squared, but wasn't getting correctly
initialised when the value of z was reset.

R=golang-dev
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6850091

No test?

On Thu, Nov 22, 2012 at 10:45 AM, <agl@golang.org> wrote:

> *** Submitted as
> http://code.google.com/p/go/**source/detail?r=b2b2ae1f5140&**repo=crypto<http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=b2b2ae1f5140&repo=crypto>***
>
>
> go.crypto/bn256: ensure that t is initialised correctly.
>
> t caches the value of z squared, but wasn't getting correctly
> initialised when the value of z was reset.
>
> R=golang-dev
> CC=golang-dev
> http://codereview.appspot.com/**6850091<http://codereview.appspot.com/6850091>
>
>
> http://codereview.appspot.com/**6850091/<http://codereview.appspot.com/6850091/>
>

On Thu, Nov 22, 2012 at 1:57 PM, Brad Fitzpatrick <bradfitz@golang.org> wrote:
> No test?

It blows up in the middle of a few thousand lines of test in another
package sadly. I wanted to sync the fix to some other machines first
to confirm that it works and I'll see about reducing the test case
now.


Cheers

AGL

subject: code review 6850091: go.crypto/bn256: ensure that t is initialised correctly.
